Literature Review: The study of social movements, power, and mediated visibility has gained significant attention in recent years, particularly in the field of anthropology. This literature review aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the current state of research in this area, highlighting the key concepts, theories, and findings that have emerged from the intersection of visual media, social movements, and hegemonic power. By examining the production, circulation, and consumption of media, researchers have been able to elucidate issues of social organization, political economy, and alternative visions for political futures. This review article will draw on a range of studies to demonstrate the importance of considering the media environment in understanding social movements and power dynamics.
